uk.text1: This document defines the elements, functions and operating principles of the PLC package for the project: @
uk.text2: This functional analysis is carried out on the basis of the following documents.
uk.text3a: This installation is controlled by a PROFACE PLC + HMI installed in the control cabinet under the drawing reference WIP
uk.text3b: Different way is used to manage and share information with equipment's installation.
uk.text4: This installation is composed of many different devices which need to communicate with each other. See the document, reference: @-OVERALL-NETWORK
uk.text5: This installation is composed of many different elements which involved to the programming and setting / sizing of automation part.See the elements listing document, reference: @-IOLIST-001
uk.text6A: This installation is managed by a set composed of one HMI (tactile panel), one PLC (type "PowerBox") and one CanOpen master board. The panel is installed on the front of the cabinet
uk.text6B: For more details see technical documentation, reference: @-SPECIFICATIONS.
uk.text6C: Installed equipment are PROFACE materials, they are programming with GP-Pro EX 4.09 SP1.Product Version:V4.09.350, (latest version).Product version date:01/02/2022
uk.text7: The installation is controlled by a PROFACE (SCHNEIDER) human machine interface.For more details see specification document reference: @-SPECIFICATIONS
table7: Start and stop installations, alarms acknowledge, installations parameters setting, access to system view
table8: Exceeding threshold in the process with an impact on the quality of the product
Exceeding threshold in the process without an impact on the quality of the product
Special Input for PT100 / 1000 or thermocouple
uk.text9B: Different types of analog variables are present in the different views. For some it is only possible to view the value, for others it is possible to enter a value.
table9D: Exceeding threshold in the process with an impact on the quality of the product
Exceeding threshold in the process without an impact on the quality of the product
uk.text9D: Alarms that have disappeared are shown in white. The alarms are acknowledged by pressing the button (level 1 required).The date and time when the alarm was triggered are indicated on the left. The number of times the alarm has been triggered is shown on the right. The alarm counter is reset by selecting the alarm table and pressing the button (level 1 required).The deletion of a disappeared alarm is done by selecting the line concerned and then pressing the "Delete" button (level 1 required). To delete all the missing alarms, select the alarm table and press the "Delete all" button (level 1 required).

FB001.text1: This is a completely custom installation, however some elements are same, for them we will use the function block programming method (FB).The instrumentation will be managed by standardized blocks, in order to ensure homogenization of the programming. These blocks are used only in the process PLC, this chapter presents their functionalities.
bulletList1: To display the measured value from an electrical signal (4-20mA or 0-10V).
To set the scale of measured value.
To filter the measured value.
To add an offset that can correct a potential derivation.
To force a value to perform tests.
To manage the display and the scales of the curves.
To know sensor fault.
To memorize 4 thresholds of alarms and one sensor fault.

To manage 4 thresholds of alarms, each threshold can be activated or deactivated via the panel (these thresholds are used for diagnostics; they are not used for the process, all alarms are temporised).
To recovery factory settings.
table1: Drive back installation to Default state
Drive back installation to Default state
table2: Go to HMI curves screen pushbutton [TAG]

uk.text18: Security management share four “big” family of faults.All faults family when triggered set a synthesis and fault message on HMI alarms screen.An acknowledgment request can acquit and reset default. Alarms are classified into 2 categories:
uk.text18A: Warning without immediate impact on the system's capacity to ensure the main functions of the process or when the state of a measurement approaches the ultimate limits of a process. Without treatment, a minor alarm can lead to a major alarm due to the evolution of the phenomenon. This type of alarm can be treated within a few days and allows to avoid major alarms.
uk.text18B: State of an equipment making it inoperable or a state of a measure having exceeded the ultimate specifications of a process.This type of alarm must be treated as an emergency to avoid loss of production and/or risk of damage to equipment.

Instrumentation.title: Intrumentation
Instrumentation.infos: All analogue measurements are processed in the same way for them we will use the function bloc programming method (FB).

Devices.title: Devices
Devices.infos: External device add to project for special needs

PT.title: Pressure transmitter
PT.A-infos: A pressure sensor is a system that converts a mechanical pressure into an electrical value.
PT.B-intro: All elements drawn on P&ID with this tag are treated on the same way:

PT I.title: Pressure transmitter whith one dry contact
PT I.A-infos: A pressure sensor is a system that converts a mechanical pressure into an electrical value. This one can provide one digital information more.
PT I.B-intro: All elements drawn on P&ID with this tag are treated on the same way:

PT 2I.title: Pressure transmitter whith two dry contact
PT 2I.A-infos: A pressure sensor is a system that converts a mechanical pressure into an electrical value. This one can provide two digital informations more.
PT 2I.B-intro: All elements drawn on P&ID with this tag are treated on the same way:

Pressostat.title: Pressostat
Pressostat.A-infos: the pressure switch allows to check the minimum pressure in the water circuit.
Pressostat.B-intro: All elements drawn on P&ID with this tag are treated on the same way:

FT.title: Flow transmitter
FT.A-infos: Magnetic flow meters consist of a transmitter and a sensor that work together to measure flow. The magnetic flowmeter sensor is placed in-line and measures an induced voltage generated by the fluid as it passes through a pipe.
FT.B-intro: All elements drawn on P&ID with this tag are treated on the same way:

FT pulse.title: Pulse flow transmitter
FT pulse.A-infos: Magnetic flow meters consist of a transmitter and a sensor that work together to measure flow. The magnetic flowmeter sensor is placed in-line and measures an induced voltage generated by the fluid as it passes through a pipe.This one can provide one digital informations more.
FT pulse.B-intro: All elements drawn on P&ID with this tag are treated on the same way:

Flow detector.A-infos: Device which provide digital information when the fluid to which it is subjected is in motion
Flow detector.B-intro: All elements drawn on P&ID with this tag are treated on the same way:

TT.A-infos: A temperature transmitter is a system that converts a temperature into an electrical value.

WLS.A-infos: A level sensor is an electronic device that measures the height of material, usually liquid, in a tank.It detects in a binary way, like a switch, if the water level reaches a certain limit or not.

fr.text1: This document defines the elements, functions and operating principles of the PLC package for the project: @
fr.text2: This functional analysis is carried out on the basis of the following documents.
fr.text3a: This installation is controlled by a PROFACE PLC + HMI installed in the control cabinet under the drawing reference WIP
fr.text3b: Different way is used to manage and share information with equipment's installation.
fr.text4: This installation is composed of many different devices which need to communicate with each other. See the document, reference: @-OVERALL-NETWORK
fr.text5: This installation is composed of many different elements which involved to the programming and setting / sizing of automation part.See the elements listing document, reference: @-IOLIST-001
fr.text6A: This installation is managed by a set composed of one HMI (tactile panel), one PLC (type "PowerBox") and one CanOpen master board. The panel is installed on the front of the cabinet
fr.text6B: For more details see technical documentation, reference: @-SPECIFICATIONS.
fr.text6C: Installed equipment are PROFACE materials, they are programming with GP-Pro EX 4.09 SP1.Product Version:V4.09.350, (latest version).Product version date:01/02/2022
fr.text7: The installation is controlled by a PROFACE (SCHNEIDER) human machine interface.For more details see specification document reference: @-SPECIFICATIONS
table7: Start and stop installations, alarms acknowledge, installations parameters setting, access to system view
table8: Exceeding threshold in the process with an impact on the quality of the product
Exceeding threshold in the process without an impact on the quality of the product
Special Input for PT100 / 1000 or thermocouple
fr.text9B: Different types of analog variables are present in the different views. For some it is only possible to view the value, for others it is possible to enter a value.
table9D: Exceeding threshold in the process with an impact on the quality of the product
Exceeding threshold in the process without an impact on the quality of the product
fr.text9D: Alarms that have disappeared are shown in white. The alarms are acknowledged by pressing the button (level 1 required).The date and time when the alarm was triggered are indicated on the left. The number of times the alarm has been triggered is shown on the right. The alarm counter is reset by selecting the alarm table and pressing the button (level 1 required).The deletion of a disappeared alarm is done by selecting the line concerned and then pressing the "Delete" button (level 1 required). To delete all the missing alarms, select the alarm table and press the "Delete all" button (level 1 required).

FB001.text1: This is a completely custom installation, however some elements are same, for them we will use the function block programming method (FB).The instrumentation will be managed by standardized blocks, in order to ensure homogenization of the programming. These blocks are used only in the process PLC, this chapter presents their functionalities.
bulletList1: To display the measured value from an electrical signal (4-20mA or 0-10V).
To set the scale of measured value.
To filter the measured value.
To add an offset that can correct a potential derivation.
To force a value to perform tests.
To manage the display and the scales of the curves.
To know sensor fault.
To memorize 4 thresholds of alarms and one sensor fault.

To manage 4 thresholds of alarms, each threshold can be activated or deactivated via the panel (these thresholds are used for diagnostics; they are not used for the process, all alarms are temporised).
To recovery factory settings.
table1: Drive back installation to Default state
Drive back installation to Default state
table2: Go to HMI curves screen pushbutton [TAG]

fr.text18: Security management share four “big” family of faults.All faults family when triggered set a synthesis and fault message on HMI alarms screen.An acknowledgment request can acquit and reset default. Alarms are classified into 2 categories:
fr.text18A: Warning without immediate impact on the system's capacity to ensure the main functions of the process or when the state of a measurement approaches the ultimate limits of a process. Without treatment, a minor alarm can lead to a major alarm due to the evolution of the phenomenon. This type of alarm can be treated within a few days and allows to avoid major alarms.
fr.text18B: State of an equipment making it inoperable or a state of a measure having exceeded the ultimate specifications of a process.This type of alarm must be treated as an emergency to avoid loss of production and/or risk of damage to equipment.

Instrumentation.title: Intrumentation
Instrumentation.infos: All analogue measurements are processed in the same way for them we will use the function bloc programming method (FB).
